install.name: Content - Dynamic Articles with TinyButStrong (TBS)
install.author: Skrol29
install.description:
Allows to include dynamic content in Joomla articles using the TinyButStrong Template Engine. Site: http://www.tinybutstrong.com,
help file: plugins/content/tinybutstrong_help.html

param.name: ChrBeg
param.label: Beginning of TBS tags
param.description: Default value is '['. TBS tags are different from plugin tags which are defined with {tbs} and {/tbs}.

param.name: ChrEnd
param.label: End of TBS tags
param.description: Default value is ']'. TBS tags are different from plugin tags which are defined with {tbs} and {/tbs}.

param.name: VarPrefix
param.label: Allowed prefix for PHP global variables
param.description: Default value is empty ('') which means all variables. You can limit the usage of PHP global variables in articles by setting a prefix for allowed variables.

param.name: AllowedIds
param.label: Allowed articles
param.description: Default value is empty ('') which mean none. Enter one or several id of articles allowed to use plugin tags, separated them with comas (,). An error is prompted if a non-allowed article contains a plugin tag such as {tbs}. Set this parameter to limit the articles that Joomla authors can use plugin tags with. You can use '*' to allow all articles, but use this value carefully because if option Direct MergeBlock is also allowed then any Joomla author will be able to display the Joomla database.

param.name: MergeBlock
param.label: Direct MergeBlock
param.option: All query types and stored procedures

param.name: ScriptPath
param.label: Script location
param.description: This is the path (relative or absolute) where scripts specified in plugin tags can be stored.

param.name: Embedded
param.label: Embedded scripts
param.description: Allow plugin tags such as {tbs}embedded{/tbs}. Please note that those tags allow to run PHP scripts which is embedded inside an article.

param.name: FullRightsIds
param.label: Full rights articles
param.description: Default value is empty. Ids of articles which are allowed to use all plugin tags with all permissions. You can seperate Ids with a coma (,). You can use '*' to allow all articles. You can use this parameter to let Admin users to use plugin tags for their own articles.
